newsitem.title: USA: Wreckage of downed airplane found on Arctic ice.
newsitem.headline: Wreckage of downed airplane found on Arctic ice.

text.p: The wreckage of a commuter airplane missing since Thursday was found on Friday on the Chukchi Sea ice, and all five people aboard were killed in the crash, officials with Alaska's North Slope Borough said.

The single-engine Cessna Caravan, which left Barrow on Thursday, was found on the ice about five miles (8 km) from the Inupiat Eskimo village of Wainwright, officials said. Wainwright is about 80 miles (128 km) southwest of Barrow.
The airplane was owned and operated by Hageland Air Service.
Identities of the victims were not released.
